title: Couple-kissing flaps for successful repair of severe sacral pressure ulcers in frail elderly patients
patient: A 92-year-old man with spinal cord injury accompanied with severe PU, as shown in Fig. , was referred to our department. The wound was debrided to leave a defect with exposure of a tendon. The plan for sacral reconstruction was devised, using CKF and the donor site of the flap was closed primarily (Fig. ). At 10-month follow-up, the flap remained intact with no evidence of suture breakdown (Fig. ).
